WorkItem.Description:
In my application targeting both Windows Store 8 App and Windows Phone 8, I am using Mvvm light toolkit to share business logic in common Portable Class Library (PCL) and consume it from W8 and WP8 projects.

I have created the PCL project targeting .NET 4.5, Windows Store 8 Apps, Windows Phone 8 only. I used libraries only PCL version of MVVM light from Nuget (the latest version * 4.4.32.1).

I have also added Mvvm light reference to Windows Store 8 project however it seems that the libraries are not compatible with .NET 4.5 instead they are built for 4.5.1. Please see the example solution demonstrating the issue attached.

Environment:

Windows 8 Operating System
Visual Studio 2012 Update 4
Mvvm Light libraries only (PCL) 4.4.32.1 version

Building Windows Store 8 app produces following warnings.

Warning	1	The primary reference "GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Platform" could not be resolved because it was built against the ".NETCore,Version=v4.5.1" framework. This is a higher version than the currently targeted framework ".NETCore,Version=v4.5".	W8
Warning	2	The primary reference "GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Platform" could not be resolved because it has an indirect dependency on the .NET Framework assembly "System.Runtime, Version=4.0.10.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a" which has a higher version "4.0.10.0" than the version "4.0.0.0" in the current target framework.	W8
WorkItem.Summary: Mvvm light incompatible binary in PCL build for Windows Store Apps
